ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to comply with formatting rules.
I learned so much. I really honed in my wet lab skills.
Crystallization, reflux, distillation, reaction mechanisms, scientific writing.
How to re-crystalize products, dry products, vacuum filtrate products. Learned about reactions.
Learnt how to do basic organic chemistry techniques, such as reflux, TLC, IR spec, MP analysis, two-solvent recrystallisation and others.
I learned a lot of new laboratory and experimental techniques.
Learned fundamental organic chemistry lab techniques and methods

I learned a lot more about safety in the lab a more techniques for purification that I did not know before. I was also able to apply the knowledge I had learned in lecture throughout the different labs.
I learned how to set up and conduct several experiments essential to orgo such as reflux reactions. Independent course.
I learned some of the basic skills of organic synthesis and product analysis, as well as the reasoning behind different experimental methods used.
Increased laboratory proficiency
I learned multiple technical and analytical laboratory skills, and learned how to write experimental plans, carry out lab procedures, and write reports.

I've taken 5 years of lab before this and been in other lab environments and Orgo Lab 1 was by far my best lab experience yet. The people are just so much nicer than gen chem and things are so much better and more fun then gen chem and you feel like you're really doing stuff. Gen Chem Lab felt like a 1.5 credit class being sneaked in as a half credit class but at least Orgo Lab felt like a 1 credit course! It gets better!
I learned how to apply my organic chemistry course material to experiments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: extremely well organized.
Weakness: tedious busywork.
i think it was good, no real weaknesses.
The quizzes are actually brutal. The course was way more work than I thought that it needed to be.
The course was very organized despite common errors in the pre lab readings. Much better than gen Chen lab. Professor DiMeglio is tough, but very kind and caring.
Strengths were the professors/TFs and the weaknesses were the quizzes.

The class was pretty easy if you have already taken CHEM 174/220, or if you have some background in organic chemistry from before college. The experimental techniques are not very difficult and the experimental plans are easy to write up. Overall, this leads to a strength of the class being a rather low workload and intellectual challenge, whilst still remaining engaging. Not sure if there are any distinctive weaknesses.
It is very hands on but sometimes a bit long.
The strengths are the teaching staff who are very helpful and the structure of the course. The very time-constrained quizzes were annoying
Experiments were fun but quizzes were way too difficult and tested beyond scope of knowledge

The preparation for the lab was just right in time commitment. Although, I still find it very unfair because of the time commitment that the lab courses require that it is only half of a credit. Throughout the whole semester this course took on average double the time commitment to assignments than the lecture course.

Strengths: big departure from the gen chem structure, labs felt more involved and you got to control how fast or how slow the experiment went.
Weakness: Honestly none, I was really happy with the structure of the course. Quizzes were a little tricky, I wish we had more time on them.
No recommendations for improvements! It was very helpful that the TAs explained the course content beforehand at the beginning of every lesson.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Not particularly riveting, but it's alright.
Yes
No it's so brutal
I guess. Its probably a requirement.
If you have to or interested in learning how reaction mechanisms work to produce different products.
Sure, if you have to do it. It's not hard and the labs can be finished very early if you are efficient with how you work, leaving you a lot of time in the day to not be doing organic chemistry.
Yes!
Yes, this likely a prerequisite but the labs are interesting and well-structured.

I would not reccommend anyone take any of teh labs because of the fact that they are only half of a credit and require so much time. My professor was amazing and such a nice person. My TA helped me out so much throughout the semester and guided me through assignments, but putting so much effort in a course that is not considered equally as valuable than others is not worth it.
I would. I loved it much better than the structure of gen Chen lab and felt like I was conducting actual labs.
Yes
Yes, I think this course taught me a lot about lab techniques used in organic chemistry and a lot of other lab skills.
yes off sequence was also better imo but I also think that might be even more relevant when it comes to the actual lecture
Yes, I would! It was very thought provoking and the administrators made themselves available at all times.

extras.title: CHEM 222L 01 - Lab for Organic Chemistry I
